explanation:
For checking the MISRA rule about pointer const-correctness we only need to know whether any callee will modify or take ownership of the objects pointed to by the const-qualified parameters in serve_simple_form (notably cls -> form and mime).

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static: must inspect its prototype/implementation to see the constness of its buffer parameter and whether it may modify or take ownership of the buffer passed (form). If it expects a non-const void * or will mutate or later free the buffer, then passing a const-qualified pointer would violate the MISRA constraint.

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls: create_response_from_buffer_static delegates to this function; its signature and free-callback semantics determine whether the buffer can be modified or freed later (ownership semantics). You need this symbol to know whether create_response_from_buffer_static treats the buffer as mutable or merely references it read-only.

- MHD_add_response_header: inspect its prototype/implementation to determine whether it modifies the header/value strings (mime) or stores and later frees them. If it mutates or takes ownership of the passed mime pointer (or requires a non-const char *), using const char *mime would conflict with MISRA requirements.

- add_session_cookie: although it does not take form or mime directly, it operates on the response and may call MHD_add_response_header internally; its implementation clarifies whether it modifies any buffers or expects non-const data related to the response object. Including it ensures we catch indirect modifications to data derived from cls/mime.

- MHD_queue_response: examine its signature to know whether it modifies the response or its payload (or takes ownership). Even if queue_response does not touch form/mime directly, ownership transfer of the response could imply later modification/freeing of the buffer that originated from a const pointer.

- MHD_destroy_response: this destructor's behavior is critical to determine whether the response lifecycle will free or modify the buffer passed to create_response_from_buffer_static. If destroy frees the buffer that was passed as form, passing a pointer to const storage may be inappropriate depending on allocation/ownership semantics.

- struct MHD_Response (definition & ownership/ownership-comments): the response object layout and its documented ownership semantics are necessary to understand whether the response stores/aliases pointers to the provided buffer/value and whether it will modify or free them. This is required to conclude whether passing const-qualified pointers into the sequence of calls in serve_simple_form is safe or violates the MISRA rule.

(Only the above symbols are required to decide whether the const-qualified pointers passed into the callees are later modified or taken ownership of; other symbols in the call graph are not necessary for this particular MISRA const-correctness check.)
